title: Subject: FTN (Fidonet) messages via NNTP: broken subject headers and unreadable characters (KOI8-R/CP866 encoding)
content:
Hello,

I am using the latest stable version of Thunderbird on Windows to read FTN (Fidonet) echo conferences that are relayed via NNTP (specifically, through Eternal September).

While the message bodies are usually readable, I have persistent issues with:

Unreadable or corrupted Subject headers

Author names displayed with wrong characters or encoding artifacts

Some headers showing as raw MIME encoding (e.g., =?KOI8-R?B?...) or complete gibberish

I suspect the issue is related to legacy Cyrillic encodings such as KOI8-R or CP866, which are still common in FTN systems. It seems Thunderbird does not properly decode these in NNTP headers.

I’ve attached a screenshot illustrating the problem.

My questions:

Is there any way to force Thunderbird to decode NNTP headers using a specific charset (like KOI8-R)?

Are there any config settings, hidden preferences (about:config), or recommended add-ons to fix this behavior?

Is there an open bug or known limitation related to non-UTF8 header decoding in NNTP messages?

I do not face this issue when reading standard UTF-8 NNTP groups or emails — only FTN-derived groups.

Thank you in advance for any advice. I’m happy to help with diagnostics or testing.

Best regards, Vladislav
creator: modelkr2000

title: Thinderbird 139 can't connect to my e-mail provider. “user name or password are wrong!”
content: After updating Thunderbird to version 139.0.2 Thunderbird can't connect to my E-Mail provider! Getting error massage saying “user name or password are wrong!” It happening on my PC with windows10 Pro and the same on my laptop with windows 11 Pro. On my browser or my mobile, I can connect without any problem to my e-mail provider. After consulting my provider, his suggestion was to try installing my account again. I did but it didn’t work (same error) I tried installing older version which Thunderbird was functioning on. It didn’t work either. Even that I cleaned my PC from Thunderbird totally. To clear this point on Versions 139.0 and 139.0.1 Thunderbird function as always before. Up to now any Thunderbird update took automatically the existing setting without any problem. Any information how to solve my problem? Thanks.
creator: nerig089

title: When using one particular Reply button, Signature missing from replies
content:
EDIT: it was an add-on. Issue wasn't replicated in troubleshooting mode.

old post: Yes, I have the account setting on for including signature in replies. It only seems to happen when I use the Reply button that's on the bottom-right -- the biggest one, at the bottom of the thread. When I use that button, a field appears below the thread, where I can type my reply, but my signature isn't there, nor is it included in the message found in the Sent folder. When I reply to an email individually, a new window opens with a field populated by my signature. So this seems like a bug to me, unless there is some obscure setting for this that I can't find. I am a new/returned user so I wanted to check in here first. If others think this is a bug, I'll go through the Bugzilla process.

In the screenshot: the reply button at the bottom doesn't include signature, while the reply button in the top right area does include signature.
creator: raptor_malice

title: Orphaned reminders
content:
In the last two weeks I have been collecting reminders that can't be dismissed and today I got a new one that is for next Sunday.

They are all birthday reminders, some from contacts, and some from entries straight into the calendar in Thunderbird. All of them are in the calendar in Google tied to my email address and when I check their details, it says they are created by an "Unknown Organizer."

I've tried to delete them in Thunderbird and in Google Contacts via the web -- they won't go away.

Thoughts? I've been using this for years and this is a new problem.

I am on Windows 10, everything is updated to the latest including Thunderbird.
creator: dklaskowski

title: How do I fix Thunderbird so it will stop deleting more than one email when I click on only one to delete?
content: Whenever I go to delete just one email in Thunderbird, every so often it will also delete the email that comes after it. So I have to go into the Deleted Messages folder and move the email back that I didn't want to delete. My Thunderbird stays updated automatically so that is not the issue. I've cleared the Thunderbird cache many times and that didn't fix the issue and my IMAP folders are synced that I know of but not sure about all the folders and not sure how to do that. I didn't have any issues with this until several months ago for no particular reason I can think of. I really don't want to uninstall and reinstall Thunderbird if I don't have to, if there is another fix if anyone has a solution. Couldn't find anything online except for the steps above I already did.
creator: Sunray407
